
# AI Assistant (Mimic)

This is an Python project which mimic the logic behind Ai Assistant.This program is a basic AI assistant that recognizes voice commands and performs various tasks based on different commands.


![Logo](https://images.idgesg.net/images/article/2018/02/artificial_intelligence_ai_virtual_assistant_robot_chatbot_machine_learning_assistive_technology_thinkstock_162685804-100749923-large.jpg?auto=webp&quality=85,70)



## Libraries/Modules

To run this project, you will need to add the following Modules/Libraries to your System.

`pyttsx3` for text-to-speech conversion

`datetime` for getting the current time

`speech_recognition` for speech recognition

`wikipedia` for accessing Wikipedia articles

`webbrowser` for opening web pages

`os` for opening files and applications.




## Functionality

![Logo](data:image/png;base64,)

- Initializing Text-to-Speech: The program initializes the text-to-speech engine using the `pyttsx3` library. It sets the voice property to the first voice available on the system.
- `speak()` Function: This function takes an audio input and converts it into speech using the text-to-speech engine. It uses the `engine.say()` method to set the input audio and `engine.runAndWait()` to play the audio.
- `greeting()` Function: This function determines the current hour and greets the user accordingly. It uses the `datetime.datetime.now().hour` method to get the current hour and checks the range to determine the appropriate greeting. After the greeting, it introduces itself as an AI assistant named Jarvis.
- `voice_commands_to_text()` Function: This function captures audio from the microphone and converts it into text using the Google Speech Recognition API. It initializes a recognizer, sets the pause threshold, listens to the audio, and uses the `recognize_google()` method to convert the audio into text. If an exception occurs or the command is not recognized, it returns "None"
- Main Execution: The program starts by calling the `greeting()` function to greet the user. Then it enters a while loop that continues indefinitely until interrupted.
- Command Processing: Inside the while loop, the program calls the `voice_commands_to_text()` function to capture the user's voice command and convert it to text. The command is converted to lowercase for easier comparison.



## Commands
Command Handling: The program checks for different commands using conditional statements (if-elif-else) and performs specific actions accordingly:

- If the command contains the word "wikipedia", it searches Wikipedia for the given query and speaks a summary of the result.
- If the command is "open google", it opens the Google homepage in a web browser.
- If the command is "open youtube", it opens the YouTube homepage in a web browser.
- If the command contains the word "in youtube", it splits the command and performs a YouTube search for the specified query.
- If the command is "current time", it speaks the current time.
- If the command is "open code", it opens Microsoft Visual Studio Code.
- If the command is "open word", it opens Microsoft Word.

**We Can also add more commands in this project and perform other diiferent tasks.**
